metadata.title: INTUITY - Complete FCE Multiple Choice Database
metadata.description: Comprehensive B2-level questions extracted from First Certificate English practice materials
metadata.notes: Complete extraction from PDF. Questions with 5 options reduced to 4 options where necessary.

questions.sentence: She heard a ____ at the door and went to see who was outside.
A young art student acted as our ____ when we visited the National Gallery.
Please ____ your bill before you leave the shop and make sure that it is correct.
If you hear the baby ____, please tell me.
The bus conductor told him to get off because he couldn't pay the ____.
I felt a sharp ____ when I put my hand in the boiling water.
I am very fond of Graham Greene's novels. He is my ____ modern author.
She chose some attractive ____ paper for the Christmas present.
It's rude to interrupt when someone else is ____.
Look, Mother! Jack has ____ you some flowers.
He ____ out of the window for a moment and then went on working.
The company made a record ____ last year.
These cars originally had two doors but the latest ____ has four.
He was killed in a car ____.
He's a nice man but he's ____ to drink too much at parties.
He has a bad cold and won't be ____ to play in the match tomorrow.
He ____ his wife and children and left them to take care of themselves.
We want to make our products cheaper than our ____.
It's the ____ in this country for the father of the bride to pay for the wedding.
He is a very ____ player. He practises for two hours every morning.
The bank will ____ you the money if you are prepared to pay them eight per cent interest on it.
I ____ him for my bad behaviour.
The sky is ____. I don't think it will rain.
I want to see all of you here tomorrow morning at nine o'clock without ____.
He ____ the letter carefully and put it in the envelope.
The price of the meal ____ a service charge.
He shouldn't be allowed to play tennis in the club. He's not a ____.
He has always wanted to see his name in ____.
He ____ his head, wondering how he could solve the problem.
Everyone who applies for a job with the company is given an intelligence ____.
Do you ____ to go to the party?
We locked the animals in the cage to ____ them from getting away.
They're old customers of ours. We've been ____ with them for many years.
I don't think I'll beat him. I'm out of ____.
If you are ____ to customers, they'll walk out of the shop.
We must get there ____ or other. If there are no buses, we'll have to take a taxi.
I'll ____ the children for you while you are out.
I wish I could ____ smoking.
We'll have to ____ the meeting until next week because no one can come tomorrow.
We went to the railway station to ____ our friends.
He was sent to prison for ____ a bank.
She bought a new ____ for the party.
My favourite ____ is roast beef.
Several of the explorers did not survive the terrible ____ across the desert.
What a beautiful dress! It ____ you perfectly.
As the two teams were ____ at the end of the game, they had to play again to decide the winners.
The books I borrowed are overdue. I'll have to take them back to the ____.
Naturally I'm ____ that I didn't pass the examination but I'll do better next time.
He was the only person to ____ the crash. Everyone else was killed.
I ____ him to go to the Lost Property office to see if his umbrella had been found.
I ____ in bed all night thinking about it.
It was on the top shelf, out of ____.
Before you take on the job, will you give me a rough ____ of how much it will cost?
The competitors in the car rally had to follow the ____ laid down by the organisers.
When the clock ____ twelve, we raised our glasses and drank to celebrate the New Year.
He had no way of making a fire so he had to eat the fish ____.
It was so hot that I had to go indoors. I couldn't ____ it any longer.
I've ____ had time to read the report so I can't give an opinion on it.
The concert was so ____ that the audience went to sleep.
What a beautiful ____! It's a pity we have no flowers to put in it.
They ____ our team by three goals to one.
He works at a big steel ____ outside the town.
I congratulated him on winning the ____.
A ____ of mine, my cousin John, is coming to stay with us.
He has been very ____ since his wife died.
At all the hotels in the town were full up, we tried to find accommodation in a ____ village.
The fish sauce was lovely, Janet. Would you mind letting me have the ____ or is it a family secret?
His parents died when he was a baby and he was ____ by his aunt.
I ____ on seeing the manager. The service here is terrible.
He ____ out of somebody I knew at school.
I ____ £5 from my father because I was short of money.
His office is on the sixth ____ of the building.
The main interest of the Trade Union is to raise its members' ____ of living.
The ____ for the race so begin was the starter firing a pistol.
If you leave your bicycle out in the rain it will get ____.
It must have rained ____ the night. The ground's still wet.
We ____ goodbye to them as the train left.
He will be given a pension when he ____ at the age of 65.
He took a ____ of cigarettes out of his pocket.
I'm sure you'll ____ the film. It's very good.
He fell in love with her at first ____.
I'm ____ if I hurt your feelings. Please forgive me.
The doctor has told him that he must not go back to work so soon after such a long ____.
No one imagined that the apparently ____ business man was really a criminal.
Where do you ____ the writing paper? In this desk?
Please ____ your hand if you want to ask a question.
As you are only 16, you must have your parents' ____ before you can get married.
The bank are offering £500 ____ to anyone who can give them useful information about the robbery.
How long do you intend to ____ in this country?
She put a ____ of chocolate on the cake.
I'll have to take the toy back to the shop to exchange it because the mechanism is ____.
Dinner will be served ____ but we have time for a drink before then.
The ____ outside the house said 'Private'.
Are you going to ____ your house in London while you are abroad?
How unkind of him to ____ to help you!
Close the door, please! I don't like sitting in a ____.
I had to stand in a ____ for hours to get the tickets for the performance.
When he was a boy his hobby was stamp ____.
He lost his ____ and threw a book at me.
I learnt to ____ a bicycle when I was six years old.
So as you think best. It doesn't ____ whether he agrees or not.
I don't think you've ____ Mrs Walker before. I'll introduce you to her.
Some town children never saw grass or trees and could play only in a small ____.
We arrived at the ____ very late when everybody there was already asleep.
He hung up his overcoat in the ____ as soon as he came into the house.
You'll be ____ your money if you buy that dress; you'll never wear it.
The ____ between England and France can be very rough.
I ____ up before six o'clock this morning.
It was very ____ of you to give me a lift.
____ you don't hurry, you'll miss the train.
I'm trying ____ to get this sentence right.
He turned up his ____ to protect his neck from the wind.
You should always keep your valuable jewellery in a ____.
The police are looking ____ the strange disappearance of the bank manager.
____ grows only in a hot climate.
Light ____ will be served during the interval.
He thinks all animal food is harmful so he lives on bread, vegetables and ____.
My brother went to Norway ____ and will return in four years' time.
The swimming pool is so ____ that it's safe for small children.
Miss Keen, a highly-qualified ____, answers all the manager's letters.
A black cat was sitting on the river ____ watching the fishermen.
____ we get some rain soon, there will be little fruit this summer.
The tourists are looking for holiday souvenirs to ____ home.
A dog can be a very pleasant ____ on long country walks.
People were walking slowly under the trees on either side of the broad ____ through the park.
If you'd only telephoned, I shouldn't have been so ____ about you.
Many elderly people find painting pictures a relaxing and enjoyable ____.
Half the students were yawning as they were ____ with the lesson.
He always seems ____, never complaining about his many troubles.
Climbing boots provide support for the wearer's ____.
The scheme has been introduced to encourage people to ____ money for their old age.
The senior accounts clerk has been ____ for dishonesty.
A new writer of plays often pays a(n) ____ to persuade someone to produce his play.
As he moved farther into the cave, he noticed that the water was moving ____.
Immediately the radio message was received, three ships changed ____ and made their way towards the sinking vessel.
The white ____ found in south-west England is used for making plates and dishes.
The light gradually ____ and darkness and cold came fainter.
It is quite ____ for you to have an immediate operation.
In the sunlight each waterdrop shone like the clearest ____.
The nurse told me that Daniel's ____ immediately after his operation was satisfactory.
One of the ____ on the wheel was loose so as soon as we saw a garage we stopped.
Far from being rough when he played with smaller children, he was always surprisingly ____.
He has lived at this ____ will his life.
The party admits it has done little about unemployment and that ____ must be discussed in detail very soon.
Before there were factories, people used to ____ cloth in their own homes.
This is a good ____ of his delight in unusual words and patterns.
If our ____ development is to be encouraged, many machines in our factories must be replaced by more efficient ones.
He said he would not ____ that had accused him of cheating.
Most of the cattle are ____ under the trees.
On leaving school he became an office-boy and having no ____ so rise higher, he only waited his time.
Short sight can be ____ by the use of suitable glasses.
Have you forgotten the ____ you made yesterday with my secretary to have the meeting in my office?
There was a sudden bright ____ of anger in his eyes as he listened to the soldier's report.
Many of those watching used handkerchiefs to ____ away the tears from their eyes.
When the poster for the house in our street I signed a(n) ____ that I would leave at the end of December.
Whether or not you like some kinds of modern furniture is a matter of ____.
He can hardly ____ having to accept orders from a man so much younger than himself.
The shopkeeper often checks his ____ to find out what to order.
He's indeed too fat but ____ that he is an excellent dancer; in contrast to ____.
The Government has expressed its ____ of the plan to build three new power stations.
The sound of our voices was completely ____ by the roar of the machinery.
He moved his glass violently as he spoke and some of the beer still remaining in it ____ on to the floor.
The scientist was studying the ____ of different kinds of objects in bright light.
They destroyed his house and his future but one day, he declares, he will ____ them suitably for what they have done.
The king had no ____ on any sideway subject.
Early man used to ____ the sun, moon, trees and stones as his gods.
In the Children's Home she has the ____ for looking after fifteen children.
The police are making very careful enquiries as this is clearly a(n) ____ of murder.
As soon as he saw his baby son he ____ his opinion that the child would be extremely clever.
Although she had been in prison for five years, she still had enough courage to make joy as event but her surroundings ____.
The library book is now overdue so I ____ have returned it a week ago.
A small ____ is handy for minor electrical jobs in the home.
Primitive man hunted and fought together with his own ____.
____ most of the furniture, it was clear that the roof must have leaked for a long time.
A poet has to be extremely ____ to the music of words.
Anyone who ____ in an examination is a thief as he is stealing marks that he has not earned.
The class teacher punished disobedient pupils ____.
Always ask for a ____ when you pay out money.
Jim ____ Joe by calling him a thief but Joe only laughed at him.
When she cleaned the high windows, she always stood on a three-legged ____.
She earns money ____ small children while their parents are at work.
It was a great ____ to study under such an outstanding teacher.
Although he never claimed to be ____ he attended church every Sunday.
It was a strange clock with an hour ____ that was longer than the minute one.
You may never again have such an interesting ____ of travel.
____ people always want more than they've got already.
William had sent his pen-friend a twenty-year-old photograph of himself and she nearly cried with ____ when they met.
Although the car had stopped, the old lady ____ to step into the road in front of it.
The bird was carrying a small branch in its ____.
On the 1st October a new government will be ____ by the nation for the next five years.
He ____ the machine carefully to see why it had broken down.
People who distribute drugs like heroin can have no ____ at all.
I haven't seen Joe ____ I wonder if he's ill.
Unless the transport strike ends soon, there will be a(n) ____ of food in the shops.
He ____ his toe into the pool and said the water was far too cold for swimming.
The dog lost interest when he realised the cat didn't intend to ____ away from him.
Ten hours' unpaid overtime a week — you're little more than a ____!
By knocking down a bicycle standing at the roadside, he ____ his own car.
Eight pounds for your room, three for dinner and two for lunch: the ____ cost will be thirteen pounds.
The angry father ____ his son that he would turn him out of the house if he got into trouble once more.
There are almost ____ opportunities for a young person who wants to go off and find adventure.
He put that ____ on his forehead when he ran into an open cupboard door in the dark a few days ago.
You can buy almost anything in this shop; ____ it has a remarkable choice of good cheap meals.
He always asks how my family is whenever the two of us ____ in his office.
It wouldn't do you any ____ to smoke less.
She always ____ a knot in her handkerchief to remind her of something she has to forget.
We ____ not take our passports as we shan't be leaving the country.
Northern Europeans ____ to have fairer hair than people from further south.
Your basic salary will be £15,000 and ____ you'll receive generous travel expenses.
She works as an operator at the local telephone ____.
I am ____ to have a quiet week-end.
A British doctor writes a ____ for medicine which a chemist or dispenser makes up.
He's always asking if he can ____ my dictionary.
Do you think scientists will ever ____ all the mysteries of the universe?
The trade negotiations in Brussels have unfortunately broken ____.
The thousands who came to ____ the football match were disappointed when fog caused its cancellation.
Dr Sylvester will be making a ____ this evening.
Will you help me to ____ for tomorrow's exam?
I hesitate to consult a solicitor as I know his ____ will be high.
Can you give me a(n) ____ as to how I can improve my English?
The ____ age of the population of Ruritania is thirty-five.
He is studying to become a member of the medical ____.
